description.para: The document to adjust the document-properties of.
A map containing the document-properties to adjust. The keys are the document-property names, the values their values.

If true (default), the supplied properties in the properties option are merged with the existing document-properties, replacing/overwriting existing ones. If false, the existing document-properties are replaced.

summary.para: The step sets or changes document-properties of the source document.

description.para: A document flowing through an XProc pipeline carries a set of document-properties with it. Document-properties are key/value pairs, where the key is a QName (which, in most cases, you can treat as just a string). Their values can be anything. Getting the value(s) of document-properties can be done using the XProc functions p:document-properties() and p:document-property().

XProc reserves three document-property names for its own usage: content-type, base-uri and serialization (see here for more information). However, you can also add your own and use them in any way you like.
The step can be used to change (most) document-properties. For an example of using see .

detail.para: The step can not change a document media type by altering the content-type document-property. Any attempt to do this will result in error . To change a document media type use .
The value of the serialization document-property must be a map of type map(xs:QName, item()*). If not error is raised.
Setting a document-property called base-uri changes the document’s base URI accordingly. See also category .
